Trump's relationship with the elder Agalarov included what the Russian billionaire said was a signed agreement to build a Trump Tower in Moscow, The Post reported, adding that Trump had boasted upon returning from Moscow in 2013 that "almost all of the oligarchs were in the room" at an after party for the pageant, which Agalarov and other investors paid $14 million to host.

His publicist, Rob Goldstone, told The Post on Sunday that he had arranged for the Trump Tower meeting, which he attended along with Donald Trump Jr., Veselnitskaya, then-campaign chairman Paul Manafort, and now-White House senior adviser Jared Kushner, who is also Trump's son-in-law.

Screenshot/YouTube President Donald Trump appeared in a 2013 music video for Emin Agalarov, an Azerbaijani-Russian pop star whose publicist claims to have arranged a June 2016 meeting between members of Trump's campaign and a Russian lawyer.

Trump Jr. said Sunday that his understanding of the meeting was that Veselnitskaya would be providing him with damaging information on Hillary Clinton, who would soon be the Democratic presidential nominee.

Agalarov was revealed to be at the center of top Trump campaign officials' meeting with Kremlin-connected lawyer Natalia Veselnitskaya.
Agalarov is the son of Aras Agalarov, a wealthy Azerbaijani-Russian developer who brought Trump's Miss Universe pageant to Moscow in 2013.
The elder Agalarov also served as a liaison between Trump and Putin when Trump was in Moscow in 2013, The Washington Post reported.
Goldstone then confirmed Monday that he arranged the meeting on behalf of the Russian pop star.
That year, Trump appeared in the younger Agalarov's music video for his song "Another Life."
"@AgalarovAras I had a great weekend with you and your family," Trump tweeted in 2013.
Trump's cameo is brief and occurs at the end of the video.
Trump shouts at a daydreaming Agalarov.
